results.title: The Joy of effort
results.creator_credit: Roman Bittman and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Shows how the adaptation of a scientific approach to different spheres of human movement is becoming increasingly important in improving performances. Shows testing and measuring different areas of fitness, for example a runner, skater, and a gymnast.

results.title: The Joy Luck Club
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass, Amy Tan and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, “The Joy Luck Club” tells the story of two generations of Chinese women. Four are mothers and wives who emigrated from China to build new lives and families in the United States. The other four are their Chinese-American daughters who are struggling to define their own identities against the expectations of their mothers and the American society where they live. Wayne Wang masterfully interweaves the stories of the eight women which spans from feudal China to modern America, highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations. “The Joy Luck Club” is a beautiful film to watch, with lavish production values which make the characters’ stories even more compelling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Wang, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass, Amy Tan and Hollywood Pictures

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

results.title: The Journey. Part 1
results.brief_description: The Journey is a fourteen and a half hour film, shown in six parts. It is not a conventional narrative film and at times, it moves slowly, deliberately allowing silence, time to think about what we have heard. “The Journey” examines aspects of the global nuclear arms industry, and, while it gives us a great deal of information, it is the voices of families from many parts of the world that we hear, voicing their fears, their discoveries, their hopes and their anger about the silencing of their voices by the media and information systems that stand between us and the truth.

results.title: The Journey of Natty Gann
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Mike Lobell and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: America is in the depths of the Great Depression. Families are broken apart when far away jobs beckon. A courageous young girl confronts overwhelming odds when she embarks on a cross-country search for her father. During her extraordinary odyssey, she forms a close bond with a magnificent protective wolf, and a hardened drifter. Stars Meredith Salenger, John Cusack, Ray Wise, Laine Kazan.
